element: Profile attributes (age range, gender, declared location, languages)
notes: Accessible via the Meta Researcher Platform for qualified projects under the DSA Article 40 framework.

element: Feed interactions (reactions, comments, shares) by content type
notes: Aggregated insights with 48-hour delay; sensitive cohorts (e.g., minors) receive additional suppression.

element: Ad library creatives with spend and targeting descriptors
notes: Creative media must be downloaded separately; spend is bucketed for campaigns below â‚¬1K.

element: Creator declared categories and follower counts
notes: Quarterly PDF releases; CSV exports announced but not yet shipped.

element: Video performance metrics (views, watch time, completion rate)
notes: Requires project vetting; watch time delivered in aggregated percentiles for privacy.

element: Election misinformation takedown counts by policy reason
notes: Breakdowns currently provided only for EU member states and selected global events.

element: Recommendation graph edges for seed channels
notes: Exposed through the YouTube Researcher Program API beta with rate limits and partial coverage.

element: Political advertiser registry with spend bands
notes: Spend buckets widen for campaigns targeting fewer than 10K impressions.

element: Account metadata (creation date, declared location, verification class)
notes: X API v2 Basic tier excludes verification class; Elevated access required.

element: Labeling activity for civic misinformation tweets
notes: Removed from public datasets in 2023; only aggregate counts in quarterly trust & safety report.

element: Account profile metadata (bio, tags, server policies)
notes: Federated data subject to individual server retention policies.
Public endpoints require pagination across instances; aggregated metrics available via ActivityPub streams.

element: Search interest index by topic and country
notes: Trends API provides normalized scores (0-100) rather than raw counts.
Counts released twice yearly with lag; EU-specific breakdown introduced in 2024.
